body:
Unfortunately the info dump doesn't really help debugging the problem, e.g. no symbol information. If you can reproduce this problem, try running the executable in gdb then getting a backtrace after the crash:

```
gdb bitcoin-qt
> run
... crash ...
> bt
```

Sorry for not updating this bug. When it occurred I was downloading many data since I was not connected to the bitcoin network since many weeks.

Today I reconnected to bitcoin-qt (since few days so it downloaded many data again) and it crash again, but not like the first time. Here is the backtrace. Note that this is bitcoin-qt 0.9.3 from the public repo so I don't know if the debug symbol are enabled, so I don't know if it will be useful for you. Anyway here the log I had:

That indeed didn't really help. Try upgrading to 0.10.1. If the problem still stays, please file a new issue, we'll figure something out for the symbols.

I'm trying to build bitcoin-qt from git in order to see if it still occurs in current version, and if yes I will have a gdb stack trace to show you.
But I'm stuck when compiling:

$ make
Making all in src
make[1]: Entering directory '/home/lecbee/bitcoin/src'
make[2]: Entering directory '/home/lecbee/bitcoin/src'
  CXX      crypto/libbitcoinconsensus_la-hmac_sha512.lo
  CXX      crypto/libbitcoinconsensus_la-ripemd160.lo
  CXX      crypto/libbitcoinconsensus_la-sha1.lo
  CXX      crypto/libbitcoinconsensus_la-sha256.lo
  CXX      crypto/libbitcoinconsensus_la-sha512.lo
  CXX      libbitcoinconsensus_la-eccryptoverify.lo
  CXX      libbitcoinconsensus_la-ecwrapper.lo
In file included from ecwrapper.cpp:10:0:
ecwrapper.cpp: In function 'int {anonymous}::ECDSA_SIG_recover_key_GFp(EC_KEY_, ECDSA_SIG_, const unsigned char_, int, int, int)':
ecwrapper.cpp:68:10: error: could not convert 'BN_zero_ex(zero)' from 'void' to 'bool'
     if (!BN_zero(zero)) { ret=-1; goto err; }
          ^
ecwrapper.cpp:68:10: error: in argument to unary !
Makefile:5501: recipe for target 'libbitcoinconsensus_la-ecwrapper.lo' failed
make[2]: *_\* [libbitcoinconsensus_la-ecwrapper.lo] Error 1
make[2]: Leaving directory '/home/lecbee/bitcoin/src'
Makefile:6435: recipe for target 'all-recursive' failed
make[1]: **\* [all-recursive] Error 1
make[1]: Leaving directory '/home/lecbee/bitcoin/src'
Makefile:615: recipe for target 'all-recursive' failed
make: **\* [all-recursive] Error 1

Looks like your OpenSSL is built with OPENSSL_NO_DEPRECATED. Annoyingly, the api is different even for non-deprecated functions with that option.

I'd say that we should fix things up to cope, but boost is not compatible with OPENSSL_NO_DEPRECATED either, and our OpenSSL usage is slowly being phased out.
So what can I do to fix that problem ? I built myself OpenSSL so I'm able to switch some build configuration parameters if necessary.
